page.title: 06POPULATION -OLD PEOPLE
page.content: WE VISITED AN OLD PEOPLE'S HOME CALLED'CHARLSTON COURT' IN BAMBER BRIDGE. WE ASKED AN OLD LADY LOTTY WHAT CHANGES HAD TAKEN PLACE IN THE AREA. SHE TOLD US THAT THE TRAFFIC HAD INCREASED A LOT AND OTHER PEOPLE THOUGHT THAT THE NUMBER OF HOUSES HAD INCREASED ENORMOUSLY. THE OLD PEOPLE SAID THAT THEY FELT MORE CONFIDENT IN THE HOME THAN IN THEIR PREVIOUS HOUSES. AN OLD GENTLEMAN -MR BILLINGTON SAID THAT IT WAS CHEAPER TO LIVE THERE THAN IN HIS OWN HOUSE.HE SAID HE GOT Â£36 AND HIS WIFE GOT Â£22 PENSION A WEEK AND BOTH OF THEM FOUND IT DIFFICULT TO LIVE ON THAT - FORTUNATELY HE HAD OTHER SOURCES OF INCOME TO HELP THE SITUATION. ALL THE OLD PEOPLE SAID THAT BILLS WERE THEIR GREATEST WORRY.
